react.title: React Framework Fundamentals
react.description: React is a JavaScript library developed by Facebook for building user interfaces. It adopts a component-based development approach and achieves efficient interface updates through the Virtual DOM mechanism. React's core features include: component architecture, declarative programming, unidirectional data flow, and a rich ecosystem.

corePoints.title: üéØ Core Points
list: Component-based development - Break down interfaces into independent, reusable components
Virtual DOM mechanism - Maintain virtual DOM tree in memory to optimize real DOM operations
Declarative programming paradigm - Describe what the interface should look like, not how to manipulate it
JSX syntax sugar - Write HTML-like syntax in JavaScript
Unidirectional data flow - Data flows from parent to child components, maintaining predictable application state

example1.title: 1. First React Component
example1.description: Basic structure of functional component, receives props parameter and returns JSX elements

example2.title: 2. Class Component Example
example2.description: Class component implemented by extending React.Component, using render method to return JSX

concepts.title: üìä Concept Diagrams
list: React rendering process: Component definition ‚Üí JSX compilation ‚Üí Virtual DOM ‚Üí Diff algorithm ‚Üí Real DOM update
React component tree structure: App component as root component, containing multiple child components, forming tree structure

performance.title: ‚ö° Performance Optimization
performance.renderingDesc: Avoid unnecessary re-renders to improve application performance
performance.bundleSizeDesc: Reduce initial loading time through dynamic imports

bestPractices.title: üöÄ Best Practices
list: Component separation: Keep components with single responsibility, easy to maintain and test
State management: Properly use useState and useReducer to manage component state
Lifecycle: Correctly use useEffect to handle side effects
Performance optimization: Avoid creating objects and functions in render

commonMistakes.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è Common Pitfalls
list: Directly mutating state, should use setState or state update functions
Forgetting to add dependencies in useEffect, may cause infinite loops
Incorrect use of key property, affecting list rendering performance
Defining functions or objects inside components, causing unnecessary child component re-renders

planning.title: Project Planning
planning.description: Design the overall architecture first, clarifying the functions and data flow of each module

incremental.title: Incremental Development
incremental.description: Start from core functions and gradually add new features

codeQuality.title: Code Quality
codeQuality.description: Keep the code clear, using appropriate naming and comments

testing.title: Test Verification
testing.description: Develop alongside testing to ensure functional correctness

developmentPrecautions.title: Development Precautions
developmentPrecautions.componentDesign: Component Design: Keep components with single responsibility, easy to maintain and reuse
developmentPrecautions.stateManagement: State Management: Organize application state reasonably, avoid unnecessary complexity
developmentPrecautions.performanceOptimization: Performance Optimization: Be careful to avoid unnecessary re-renders, use memo appropriately
developmentPrecautions.userExperience: User Experience: Consider interaction details such as loading states and error handling

stepDescriptions.understand: Carefully read the problem description, clarify input/output format and constraints
stepDescriptions.analyze: Determine data structures and algorithms to use, consider time complexity
stepDescriptions.implement: Write basic solution first, ensure logic is correct, then consider optimization
stepDescriptions.test: Test with sample data, check edge cases

indexOutOfBounds.title: Index Out of Bounds:
indexOutOfBounds.description: Check index range before accessing list elements

variableNaming.title: Variable Naming:
variableNaming.description: Use meaningful variable names, avoid single-letter naming

boundaryConditions.title: Boundary Conditions:
boundaryConditions.description: Consider special cases like empty input, single element

algorithmComplexity.title: Algorithm Complexity:
algorithmComplexity.description: Avoid unnecessary nested loops, optimize time complexity

careerStage.interviewDescription: In-depth discussion of algorithm application scenarios, optimization ideas and practical project experience

aiTeacher.greeting: Hello! I'm your AI teaching assistant. I can help you understand algorithm problems and solve programming questions. What do you need help with?
aiTeacher.helpPrompt: I understand your question. For this algorithm problem, I suggest you first analyze the time complexity requirements, then choose the appropriate data structure to optimize the solution. Do you need more specific help?
aiTeacher.conceptExplanation: Let the AI teacher explain concepts in detail and draw diagrams on the blackboard

interviewer.greeting: Hello! Welcome to this technical interview.
interviewer.todayTopic: Today we're going to discuss the problem: {title}
interviewer.startPrompt: Please first describe the core problem of this question in your own words, then tell me your solution approach.
interviewer.analyzingCode: AI interviewer is analyzing your code...
interviewer.preparingQuestions: AI interviewer is preparing opening questions...
interviewer.evaluatingDescription: Analyzing your code quality, algorithm approach and interview performance
interviewer.fallbackResponse: Great answer! Let's continue to explore this problem in depth.
interviewer.errorResponse: Sorry, I can't reply right now. Please try again later.
interviewer.evaluationComplete: Evaluation complete, thank you for your participation!
interviewer.codingPrompt: Great! Now please start implementing your solution in the editor below, explaining your approach as you code.
interviewer.followUpQuestion: Do you think there's room for optimization in this algorithm?
interviewer.understandingPrompt: Please first tell me your understanding of this problem, what's your solution approach?

loading.enhancedContent: Enhanced content loaded! {title} now includes multiple solutions and AI explanations.
loading.welcomeMessage: Welcome to {title} coding practice! This is a {difficulty} difficulty {pattern} problem. Let's get started!
loading.problemNotFound: Problem not found: pattern "{pattern}", problem ID "{problemId}"

codeTemplate.partialPass: ‚ùå Some test cases failed, please check your code

ui.targetDescription: Given an array of integers nums and an integer target, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target.

followUp.timeComplexityQuestion: Great! Can you analyze the time complexity of this algorithm?
followUp.otherApproachQuestion: Nice solution! Do you think there are other implementation approaches?
followUp.optimizationQuestion: If the data volume is very large, how would you optimize this algorithm?
followUp.boundaryQuestion: Have you considered handling boundary cases? Like empty arrays or duplicate elements?
followUp.allTestsPassed: Excellent! All test cases passed. Can you analyze the time and space complexity of this algorithm?
followUp.mostTestsPassed: Good, most test cases passed. What do you think might be causing the failed test cases?
followUp.fewTestsPassed: It looks like there are still some issues with the code. Can you explain your approach? Let's analyze it together.

fallback.unknownResponse: No problem, let's take it step by step. For {title}, what do you think is the most intuitive approach?
fallback.hashMapResponse: Great! What should the keys and values of the hash table store?
fallback.bruteForceResponse: Right, the brute force approach is intuitive. Can you analyze the time complexity?
fallback.complexityResponse: Good analysis! What about space complexity? Any optimization methods?
fallback.implementationResponse: Okay, can you specifically explain your implementation approach?
fallback.analysisResponse: Let's analyze the complexity of this method.
fallback.boundaryResponse: Great! What other boundary cases need to be considered?

aiLecture.preparing: Preparing detailed explanation of {topic} for you...
aiLecture.prompt: As a professional algorithm teacher, please provide detailed explanation about "{topic}" for the algorithm problem {title}.
aiLecture.contentGenerated: Explanation content for {topic} has been generated
aiLecture.blackboardDrawing: Drawing {topic} illustrations on the blackboard for you...
aiLecture.voiceFailed: Audio generation failed, but text content is ready for you to read

evaluation.finalEvaluationPrompt: As a senior technical interviewer, please provide a comprehensive evaluation of the entire interview process
evaluation.defaultSummary: Evaluation system temporarily unable to complete analysis.

evaluationCriteria.technicalDepth: Technical depth (algorithm complexity analysis, optimization thinking)
evaluationCriteria.communication: Communication skills (clarity and professionalism of answers)
evaluationCriteria.learningAttitude: Learning attitude (receptiveness to suggestions and depth of thinking)
evaluationCriteria.evaluationStandard: Evaluation criteria: Excellent(90-100), Good(75-89), Average(60-74), Needs Improvement(below 60)
evaluationCriteria.jsonFormat: Please output evaluation results in the following JSON format:
evaluationCriteria.recommendationExample: whether to recommend for next round

aiPrompts.codingGuidance1: Great idea! Now let's start coding. Please implement your solution in the code editor on the right.
aiPrompts.codingGuidance2: Very clear understanding! Now please implement this algorithm, I'll observe your coding process.
aiPrompts.codingGuidance3: Clear approach! Let's start coding now, feel free to ask if you have any questions.
aiPrompts.goodAnswer: Great answer! Let's continue to explore this problem in depth.

examples.bruteForceHint: A simple implementation uses nested for loops with O(n¬≤) time complexity
examples.hashTableHint: You can use a hash table to reduce time complexity to O(n)
examples.hashTableCheck: When traversing to number x, check if target - x exists in the hash table
examples.requirementAnalysis: Analyze the input and output requirements of the problem

codeExampleTexts.approach: Approach: Traverse array, calculate complement for each element, then check if complement exists in hash map
codeExampleTexts.timeComplexity: Time Complexity: O(n) - only need to traverse array once
codeExampleTexts.spaceComplexity: Space Complexity: O(n) - worst case need to store n-1 elements
codeExampleTexts.indexesList: List of indices of the two numbers, e.g. [0, 1]
codeExampleTexts.createHashMap: Create hash map to store {value: index} mapping
codeExampleTexts.traverseArray: Traverse array, getting both index and value
codeExampleTexts.checkComplement: Check if complement already exists in hash map
codeExampleTexts.foundPair: Found it! Return indices of complement and current number
codeExampleTexts.storeInHashMap: If no complement found, store current number in hash map
codeExampleTexts.keyValueComment: Key is value, value is index position
codeExampleTexts.notFoundReturn: If no solution found after traversal, return empty list
codeExampleTexts.guaranteedSolution: (Problem guarantees solution exists, so this won't execute)

hints.bruteForceLoop: A simple implementation uses nested for loops with O(n¬≤) time complexity
hints.hashTableOptimization: You can use a hash table to reduce time complexity to O(n)
hints.complementCheck: When traversing to number x, check if target - x exists in the hash table

problemDescriptions.twoSum: Given an array of integers nums and an integer target, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target. You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice. You can return the answer in any order.

errors.sorry: Sorry, I can't reply right now. Please try again later.
errors.parseFailed: Evaluation result parsing failed, using original text
errors.problemGenerationFailed: Failed to generate initial interview question

guidance.implementLogic: Implement solution logic step by step

feedback.solutionIncomplete: Some test cases didn't pass, keep trying!
